syscalls.comment: Process lifecycle - execve: container init, exit/exit_group: normal shutdown
Go runtime goroutines - clone/clone3: Go spawns OS threads for goroutines, fork/vfork: rare but needed for exec
Go runtime scheduling - futex: all Go mutex/sync primitives use this, sched_yield: cooperative scheduling, sched_getaffinity: GOMAXPROCS auto-detection
Go runtime memory management - mmap/munmap: heap allocation, mprotect: GC write barriers, madvise: MADV_DONTNEED for GC, brk: legacy allocator
Go signal handling - sigaltstack: Go handles signals on goroutine stacks, rt_sigaction/rt_sigprocmask: signal setup, rt_sigreturn: return from signal handler, tgkill: send signals to threads
Go netpoller (epoll) - epoll_create1/epoll_ctl/epoll_wait/epoll_pwait: Go runtime uses epoll for ALL network I/O, Grafana's HTTP server depends on this

Network I/O - socket/bind/listen/accept: Grafana HTTP server on :3000, connect: outbound connections to data sources, Prometheus, etc., sendto/recvfrom: UDP/TCP I/O, setsockopt: TCP_NODELAY, SO_REUSEADDR, etc.
File I/O (modern openat-based) - openat/openat2: Go 1.11+ uses openat instead of open, Grafana reads config files, plugins, dashboards, readlinkat: resolve symlinks, fstatat: stat files
Directory operations - getdents64: read directory entries for plugin discovery, dashboard scanning, mkdirat: create directories for data/logs (if needed)
Legacy file I/O - open/stat/lstat/statx: older and modern syscalls, access: check file permissions
Pipes and eventfd - pipe2: Go runtime uses pipes for internal signaling, eventfd2: async notification mechanism
Process/thread info - getpid/gettid: process identification, getuid/getgid: permission checks, getrusage: resource monitoring for Grafana metrics
Time operations - clock_gettime: timestamps for logs/metrics, nanosleep: time.Sleep() in Go, gettimeofday: legacy time functions
Timers - timerfd for Go time.After(), setitimer for profiling, alarm for timeouts
Randomness - getrandom: crypto/rand for TLS, session tokens, CSRF protection in Grafana
I/O multiplexing - poll/select: legacy I/O multiplexing, some C libraries still use these, pselect6: signal-safe select
Process resource limits - getrlimit/setrlimit: manage file descriptor limits, prlimit64: modern rlimit interface
Thread-local storage - arch_prctl: x86_64 TLS setup for Go threads, set_tid_address: thread exit notification
prctl operations - prctl: Go runtime uses PR_SET_NAME for thread naming, PR_SET_PDEATHSIG for cleanup
Inotify - inotify for file watching (config reload, plugin hot-reload in Grafana)
uname - uname: OS detection for telemetry, compatibility checks
Filesystem attributes - statfs: check disk space for Grafana data directory, getxattr: read extended attributes (SELinux contexts, etc.)
wait operations - wait4/waitpid: wait for child processes (if Grafana spawns any external processes)
umask - umask: set file creation mask for proper permissions
getcwd - getcwd: get current working directory, used by Go runtime and file path resolution
capset/capget - capset/capget: capability management, needed if Grafana drops privileges
DISABLED: mount/umount — Grafana does not need to mount filesystems
DISABLED: ptrace — Debugging/introspection not needed in production. Security risk for container escape
DISABLED: io_uring — Go runtime does not use io_uring. Multiple kernel CVEs (CVE-2023-2598, CVE-2024-0582). Not needed for Grafana
DISABLED: clock manipulation — adjtimex/clock_settime/settimeofday: Grafana should not modify system time. Read-only time access is sufficient
DISABLED: personality with UNAME26 — Used to bypass security checks. No legitimate use in Grafana
DISABLED: modify_ldt — x86 segment manipulation, legacy feature, security risk
DISABLED: POSIX message queues — mq_* syscalls not used by Go runtime or Grafana
DISABLED: fanotify — Filesystem event monitoring not needed, inotify is sufficient
DISABLED: process_mrelease — OOM killer optimization, not needed in containerized Grafana
DISABLED: system reboot/shutdown — kexec_load/kexec_file_load/reboot/swapon/swapoff: Grafana should never reboot the system
DISABLED: kernel modules — init_module/finit_module/delete_module: Grafana does not load kernel modules
DISABLED: BPF — bpf: eBPF is a kernel programming interface. Grafana does not use BPF. Major security risk
DISABLED: userfaultfd — Userspace page fault handling, not used by Go. Known container escape vector
DISABLED: keyring operations — add_key/request_key/keyctl: Kernel keyring not used by Grafana
DISABLED: perf_event_open — Performance monitoring/profiling. Not needed in production Grafana
DISABLED: quotactl — Filesystem quota management not needed in container
DISABLED: lookup_dcookie — oprofile support, not used
DISABLED: kcmp — Compare kernel objects between processes, debugging tool, not needed
DISABLED: name_to_handle_at/open_by_handle_at — NFS file handle operations, not used in containerized Grafana
DISABLED: acct — Process accounting, not needed
DISABLED: nfsservctl — NFS server control, not applicable
DISABLED: seccomp — Grafana should not modify its own seccomp policy at runtime
DISABLED: vmsplice/tee/splice — Advanced pipe operations. Rare use, potential security issues
DISABLED: remap_file_pages — Deprecated in kernel, not used by Go
DISABLED: mbind/set_mempolicy/get_mempolicy — NUMA memory policy. Not needed in typical containerized Grafana
